text: I'm Josh Boone and I'm the director of
The Fault in Our Stars so this is a
scene that comes late in the movie where
Gus played by Ansel Elgort has brought
Isaac played by NAT Wolff to the house
of a girl who wronged him earlier in the
movie who broke up with him and they are
gonna egg her car with Miss shailene
woodley playing hazel grace Lancaster
nat wolff is wearing blinding sunglasses
and blinding contacts he did that the
entire time we shot there was a itech on
set putting drops in his eyes they're
very uncomfortable and that doesn't wear
glasses or contacts in real life some of
the eggs that we throw towards the
camera are rubber eggs and the ones that
you see from the other side are real
eggs it was one of the more fun scenes
to shoot just cuz Nats energy is so high
in it and like you just kind of wind him
up and let him go blind so I can hear
when you make fun of my disability we're
in a neighborhood in Pittsburgh somebody
was kind enough to let us use their
beautiful home
I don't know how happy they were with us
there's a beat here where you'll see an
egg go flying through the door which was
not the intention went all over the very
expensive rug and furniture inside and
we had to pay a little bit of money to
fix that situation uh-huh and you're
gonna now see the rubber egg bouncing
across the lawn behind NAT which is a
gaff but we liked it so we left it your
daughter she's done a great injustice so
we've come here seeking revenge you see
we may not look like much but between
the three of us we have five legs four
eyes and two and a half working pairs of
lungs but um this was a audition speech
that everybody who played Gus who
auditioned came in and read the scene
there's the very first scene I showed
John Green edited together full it
hasn't changed any think really at all
since we cut it the first time
